title: `warn(path_statements)` triggers when using constants to limit values of `const usize`

labels.name: A-lint
labels.description: Area: Lints (warnings about flaws in source code) such as unused_mut.

labels.name: D-incorrect
labels.description: A diagnostic that is giving misleading or incorrect information

body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.
-->

As referenced from https://github.com/rust-lang/rust-clippy/issues/9080

I tried this code:

```rust
#[repr(C, align(4096))]
pub struct Buffer<const N: usize = 4096> {
    data: [u8; N],
}

impl<const N: usize> Buffer<N> {
    // Ensure that `N` is a multiple of 4096
    const CHECK_ALIGNED: () = if N & 4095 != 0 {
        panic!("Buffer size must be a multiple of 4096")
    };

    pub const fn new() -> Self {
        #[allow(path_statements)]
        Self::CHECK_ALIGNED;
        Buffer { data: [0u8; N], }
    }
}

fn main() {
    let buf1 = Buffer::<4096>::new();
    // let buf2 = Buffer::<4097>::new();
    let buf3 = Buffer::<8192>::new();
    println!("Size of buf1: {}", core::mem::size_of_val(&buf1));
    println!("Size of buf3: {}", core::mem::size_of_val(&buf3));
}
```

I expected this to compile without warning

Instead, this happened:

```
warning: path statement with no effect
  --> src/main.rs:14:9
   |
14 |         Self::CHECK_ALIGNED;
   |         ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
   |
   = note: `#[warn(path_statements)]` on by default
```

Playground link: https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2021&gist=266aa082052cfca6fcb4f051d239e9f0
